paragraphs.title: Imports
paragraphs.text:
//imports to preprocessing
import org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame

import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.DecisionTreeClassifier

import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.NaiveBayes

//imports to clustering
import org.apache.spark.ml.clustering.KMeans

import scala.util.matching._

result.msg:
import org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame

import org.apache.spark.sql.expressions.Window

import org.apache.spark.ml.feature.{Tokenizer, RegexTokenizer, IDF, CountVectorizer, NGram, CountVectorizerModel, StopWordsRemover}

import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.DecisionTreeClassificationModel

import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.DecisionTreeClassifier

import org.apache.spark.ml.evaluation.MulticlassClassificationEvaluator

import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.NaiveBayes

import org.apache.spark.ml.clustering.KMeans

import sqlContext.implicits._

import org.apache.spark.sql.functions._

import scala.util.matching._

paragraphs.title: Preprocessing
paragraphs.text:
val inputFile = "/home/mrc/Facultad/BigData/zeppelin-0.6.1-bin-all/doc/oscars_trim.json"

val input_rdd = sc.wholeTextFiles(inputFile).values
val input = spark.read.json(input_rdd)

val dfData = input.select(explode(input("data"))).toDF("tweet")
val dfSanitized = dfData.select("tweet.created_at","tweet.id_str","tweet.text","tweet.user.name", "tweet.user.profile_image_url", "tweet.user.screen_name")

val created_ord = Window.orderBy("created_at")
val row_numberDF = row_number().over(created_ord)
val orderedDF  = dfSanitized.select(row_numberDF as 'n_tweet, '*)


/*
\\b Match word bounds
\\w+ Match words
#?\\b\\w+\\b    <----- hashtag
@?\\b\\w+\\b    <----- mentions
\\bhttps?://\\S* <----- URLS
*/
//REGEX TOKENIZER
val regexTokenizer = new RegexTokenizer()
    .setInputCol("text")
    .setOutputCol("words")
    .setPattern("(?U)\\bhttps?://\\S*|#?\\b\\w+\\b|@?\\b\\w+\\b")
    .setGaps(false)
    .setToLowercase(true)

val tokenizedTweetDF = regexTokenizer.transform(orderedDF)
/*
val tokenizer = new Tokenizer()
    .setInputCol("text")
    .setOutputCol("words")
    
val tokenizedTweetDF = tokenizer.transform(orderedDF)
*/

//creo conjunto de stopWords
val stopWords = StopWordsRemover.loadDefaultStopWords("english").toSet++Set("rt","ht","ho")
//instancia de stopwordsremover y ejecuto sobre el df
val remover = new StopWordsRemover()
  .setInputCol("words")
  .setOutputCol("filtered")
  .setStopWords(stopWords.toArray)

val cleanedTweetDF = remover.transform(tokenizedTweetDF)

val ngram = new NGram()
    .setInputCol("filtered")
    .setOutputCol("ngrams")
    .setN(1)
    
val nGramTweetDF = ngram.transform(cleanedTweetDF)

val countVectorizer : CountVectorizerModel = new CountVectorizer()
    .setInputCol("ngrams")
    .setOutputCol("rawFeatures")
    .setMinTF(1)
    .fit(nGramTweetDF)

val vectorizedTweetDF = countVectorizer.transform(nGramTweetDF)

//tf*idf
val idfTweet = new IDF()
    .setInputCol("rawFeatures")
    .setOutputCol("features")
    .fit(vectorizedTweetDF)

val processedTweetDF = idfTweet.transform(vectorizedTweetDF)

//processedTweetDF.select("n_tweet","words","rawFeatures","features")show(false)

paragraphs.title: Clustering
paragraphs.text:
//REVISAR CAPITULO 4
// Trains a k-means model.
val kmeans = new KMeans()
    .setFeaturesCol("features")
    .setPredictionCol("clusterNr")
    .setK(4)
    .setMaxIter(10)
    .setSeed(1L)
    
val model_kmeans = kmeans.fit(processedTweetDF)
val tweetClusters = model_kmeans.transform(processedTweetDF)

paragraphs.title: Sentiment Classifier
paragraphs.text:
val inputFilePositive = "/home/mrc/Facultad/BigData/zeppelin-0.6.1-bin-all/doc/lexicon/positive-words.txt"
val inputFileNegative = "/home/mrc/Facultad/BigData/zeppelin-0.6.1-bin-all/doc/lexicon/negative-words.txt"

val posDF = sc.wholeTextFiles(inputFilePositive).values.map{row => row.split("\n")}.toDF("value")
val positiveDF = posDF.select(explode($"value").as("value")).withColumn("label",lit(1))

val negDF = sc.wholeTextFiles(inputFileNegative).values.map{row => row.split("\n")}.toDF("value")
val negativeDF = negDF.select(explode($"value").as("value")).withColumn("label", lit(0))

val dataDF = negativeDF.union(positiveDF)

//tokenizo la entrada
val tokenizerLexicon = new Tokenizer()
    .setInputCol("value")
    .setOutputCol("words")
    
val tokenizedLexiconDF = tokenizerLexicon.transform(dataDF)

//remuevo palabras stopwords
val stopWordsLexicon = StopWordsRemover.loadDefaultStopWords("english")
//instancia de stopwordsremover y ejecuto sobre el df
val removerWordLexicon = new StopWordsRemover()
  .setInputCol("words")
  .setOutputCol("filtered")
  .setStopWords(stopWordsLexicon)


val cleanedLexiconDF = removerWordLexicon.transform(tokenizedLexiconDF)

val ngramLexicon = new NGram()
    .setInputCol("filtered")
    .setOutputCol("ngrams")
    .setN(1)

val nGramLexiconDF = ngramLexicon.transform(cleanedLexiconDF)

//Uso el modelo creado para los tweets
val vectorizedLexiconDF = countVectorizer.transform(nGramLexiconDF)


//tf*idf
val idfLexicon = new IDF()
    .setInputCol("rawFeatures")
    .setOutputCol("features")

//Entreno idf 
val idfLexiconModel = idfLexicon.fit(vectorizedLexiconDF)
//transformo con idf
val processedLexiconDF = idfLexiconModel.transform(vectorizedLexiconDF)

paragraphs.title: Naive Bayes
paragraphs.text:
//Creo el modelo naive Bayes y entreno con las criticas del cine
val Array(trainData, testData) = processedLexiconDF.randomSplit(Array(0.7, 0.3), seed=1000L)

val nbModel = new NaiveBayes().fit(trainData)

val predictions = nbModel.transform(testData)

paragraphs.title: Evaluator Naive Bayes
paragraphs.text:
val evaluator = new MulticlassClassificationEvaluator()
  .setLabelCol("label")
  .setPredictionCol("prediction")
  .setMetricName("accuracy")
val accuracy = evaluator.evaluate(predictions)
println("Accuracy: " + accuracy)
